intro: Daphnopsis brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian daphnopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries that are edible for some bird species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
